action.action-desc: Mr. Tony Gonzales of Texas (for himself, Mr. Norman, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Mast, Mr. Rouzer, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Reschenthaler, Mr. Jackson, Mr. Lamborn, and Mr. Budd) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To punish the distribution of fentanyl resulting in death as felony murder.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Felony Murder for Deadly Fentanyl Distribution Act.

section.header: Fentanyl distribution resulting in death punished as felony murder
section.text: Section 1111 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting , distributing fentanyl after child abuse;

subparagraph.text: by striking (b) Within and inserting (b) (1) Within; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Whoever is guilty of murder in the first degree by distributing fentanyl shall be punished by death or by imprisonment for life.

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (6) as paragraphs (6) through (8), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

paragraph.text: the terms controlled substance, distribute, and distributor have the meanings given the terms in section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 802);
distributing fentanyl means to distribute a controlled substance—

subparagraph.text: involving 2 grams or more of a mixture or substance containing a detectable amount of N-phenyl-N-[1-(2-phenylethyl)-4-piperidinyl] propanamide or .5 grams or more of a mixture or substance containing a detectable amount of any analogue of N-phenyl-N-[1-(2-phenylethyl)-4-piperidinyl] propanamide;
that results in death from the use of such mixture or substance; and
knowing or having reason to know contains a detectable amount of such mixture or substance.
